intro: Pentadenia trollii, commonly known as the Tasmanian bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Tasmania. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange floral spikes that resemble bottle brushes. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is typically found in open forests and heathlands. It produces small, fragrant flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a valuable component of Tasmania's native flora.
